intro: Agapetes sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim silverleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Himalayas, particularly found in the eastern regions of Nepal and Sikkim. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in a dense layer of silver-white pubescence. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in mountain forests. Agapetes sikkimensis produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring.
